title: Lance Gooden
added: On March 3, 2021, Gooden was the only Republican in the House of Representatives to vote in favor of the [[George Floyd Justice in Policing Act]], which narrowly passed 220-212. Later that evening however, Gooden tweeted that he voted for the bill “accidentally”, claiming he pushed the wrong button, a mistake he failed to notice in time.<ref> Budryk, Zach, “Sole GOP vote on House police reform bill says he 'accidentally pressed the wrong voting button'”, ''The Hill'' (March 3, 2021). www.google.com/amp/s/thehill.com/homenews/house/541553-sole-gop-vote-on-police-reform-bill-says-he-accidentally-pushed-the-wrong%3famp. Retrieved March 4, 2021. </ref> Gooden then tweeted that he had “arguably the most conservative/America First voting record in Congress”, and “Of course I wouldn’t support the radical left’s, Anti-Police Act”, reffering to the bill. According to Gooden he had the official record changed to reflect his opposition.<ref>https://mobile.twitter.com/Lancegooden/status/1367311137285541894?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1367311137285541894%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fd-42381765093580676973.ampproject.net%2F2102200206005%2Fframe.html</ref>
